Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!

The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal to all buddhas the world as completely devoid of characteristics and devoid of aspirations, and is called the mother of buddhas, able to reveal to all buddhas the true characteristics of the world.
World-Honored One!
How is it that prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal to all buddhas the world as completely devoid of characteristics and devoid of aspirations?

The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ can reveal to the buddhas that the world of form is purely signless and wishless, and that the world of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness is purely signless and wishless;

They can reveal to all buddhas that the world of the nose realm is purely characterized by signlessness and wishlessness, and that the world of the smell realm, nose consciousness realm, nose contact, and the feelings produced from the conditions of nose contact are purely characterized by signlessness and wishlessness;

They can reveal to all buddhas that the world of the tongue realm is purely characterized by signlessness and wishlessness, and that the world of the taste realm, tongue consciousness realm, tongue contact, and the feelings produced from the conditions of tongue contact are purely characterized by signlessness and wishlessness;

They can reveal to all buddhas that the world of the body realm is purely characterized by signlessness and wishlessness, and that the world of the touch realm, body consciousness realm, body contact, and the feelings produced from the conditions of body contact are purely characterized by signlessness and wishlessness;

They can reveal to all buddhas that the world of the mind realm is purely characterized by the absence of characteristics and the absence of wishes, and that the world of the mental consciousness realm, mental contact, and the feelings produced from the condition of mental contact are purely characterized by the absence of characteristics and the absence of wishes;

They can reveal to all buddhas that the world of the earth element is purely characterized by the absence of characteristics and the absence of wishes, and that the worlds of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are purely characterized by the absence of characteristics and the absence of wishes;

They can reveal to all buddhas that the world of ignorance is purely characterized by the absence of characteristics and the absence of wishes, and that the worlds of karmic formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and anxiety are purely characterized by the absence of characteristics and the absence of wishes;

They can reveal to all buddhas that the world of the perfection of giving is purely characterized by the absence of characteristics and the absence of wishes, and that the worlds of the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom are purely characterized by the absence of characteristics and the absence of wishes;

They can manifest to all buddhas that the world is purely characterized by the absence of characteristics and the absence of wishes, and that external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, emptiness of the ultimate, emptiness of the beginningless and endless, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of unchanging nature, emptiness of inherent characteristics, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of self-nature, and emptiness of the nature of self-nature are all purely characterized by the absence of characteristics and the absence of wishes.

They can manifest to all buddhas that the world is purely characterized by the absence of characteristics and the absence of wishes, and that suchness, the dharma realm, the nature of dharmas, the non-erroneous nature, the unchanging nature, the nature of equality, the nature of detachment from birth, the determination of dharmas, the abiding of dharmas, the ultimate reality, the space element, and the inconceivable element are all purely characterized by the absence of characteristics and the absence of wishes.

They can reveal to all buddhas that the mundane door of liberation by emptiness is purely signless and wishless, and that the doors of liberation by signlessness and wishlessness are purely signless and wishless;

The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, which can reveal the characteristics of the world to the buddhas, means causing them not to give rise to the notion of this world or the notion of another world.
Why is it so?
Because there are actually no dharmas that can give rise to the notion of this world or the notion of another world.

The profound prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ appears in the world for the sake of innumerable matters.
